The claim is based on an audio message f: The message claims to be based on research from Chinese scientists.
The fact: checkers found that some of the claims in the audio message have been circulating on social media since January and have been debunked by public health officials.
The Centers for Disease Control and Prev: CDC) states that the primary way the virus spreads is through close contact with infected people and respiratory droplets. The CDC advises people to avoid touching their face, wash their hands regularly, cover coughs and sneezes, and sanitize surfaces to prevent infection.
The World Health Organization: WHO) has debunked certain claims related to preventing coronavirus infection, such as drinking water or relying on sunlight exposure to kill the virus. The WHO states that there is no evidence that sunlight kills the new coronavirus.
